item.title: Report X-2025071255
item.description:
Report X-2025071255

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-10
  • City: Peoria
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Crew reported vapor and an audible sound releasing from the top of CBTX 785257. Contractor was notified as well as local FD. The contractor arrived to confirm that the release was occurring from the pressure relief valve and also determined that the PRV had suffered a mechanical failure. Tactics were implemented to reduce the release to a negligible amount. The local FRA assisted with allowing the movement of the car 9 rail miles to the destination for offloading while being shadowed by contractors.

item.title: Report X-2025071129
item.description:
Report X-2025071129

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-07-07
  • City: MESA
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DECLARED GROUND LEAKING HAZMAT. THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WAS NOTIFIED ABOUT A LEAKING HAZMAT IN THE PRELOAD OPERATION. WEARING THE APPROPRIATE PPE, THE DESIGNATED RESPONDER WENT TO LOCATION OF THE SPILL FOR CLEAN UP. PLACING THE LEAKER IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND UTILIZING THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET. THE RESPONDER THEN RETURNED WITH THE PACKAGE/DEBRIS TO THE DAMAGE CAGE FOR FURTHER INSPECTION.

item.description:
Report E-2025060540

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-16
  • City: MORENCI
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: MARATHON PETROLEUM COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver started to unload at the Morenci blasting tank 42. The driver noticed a leak had occurred which he thought was at the hose connection. He started to shut down the unloading process so he could change the 3-inch hose gasket, right before he turned the pump off the red diesel sprayed from a gasket on the valve which was on the suction side of the pump. Approximately 2-3 gallons sprayed on the ground. No injuries resulted in this incident.

item.title: Report E-2025070054
item.description:
Report E-2025070054

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-03
  • City: KINGMAN
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1149 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at unmanned terminal UKA. It was reported that approximately 20 gallons of AFCO 5579 Clean Trac MC released from a tote due to forklift puncture. The release impacted dock 13. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors responded and observed that a 50- gallon release of AFCO 5597 was released due to a Forklift Puncture. The Contractor inspected the AFCO 5597. The contractor advised (3) 55G DF / (1) 65G DF of waste was generated. All waste was left on-site. The contractor left all waste onsite

item.title: Report E-2025070051
item.description:
Report E-2025070051

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-02
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO ENTERPRISE SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 2224 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at UPH. It was reported that approximately 10 gallons of Blue Raspberry Base were released from a 10-gallon plastic pail due to improper bracing by terminal BCA. The release impacted trailer # 3193590 at dock door 111. ERTS will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of UN2920 Blue Raspberry Base product released to an 8 x 4 area of the wooden trailer floor due to improper loading. The contractors noted there were (5) 10-gallon plastic pails damaged or leaking. They containerized the (5) damaged/leaking pails into (2) 55- gallon poly drums along with PPE and pallet pieces. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2025060065
item.description:
Report I-2025060065

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-05
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: MUSKET CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 429110
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On February 5, 2025, at 7:17 PM MST Facility operations personnel began discharging rail cars of denatured ethanol into a header which was believed to deliver product to the Facility tank farm for product storage. A total of six (6) railcars were connected to an approximately 1900 foot incomplete, under construction product header which contained an open 12" flange with dust cap, and thirteen (13) open piping elbows. At 8:49 PM MST Facility operators discovered the release along the incomplete product header and shutdown unloading pumps and closed valves on product railcars by 9:01 PM MST. Over the 1.5-hour period, a total of 82,431 gallons of denatured was released across an approximately 730' section of the product header from the six (6) railcars that were connected. The denatured ethanol impacted the underlying ballast and migrated to the West and South of the direct spill area to low-lying areas on the leased property and the Burlington Northern & Santa Fe (BNSF) Railroad property.
